Aggregate data from source zones to target polygons using areal weights

Source: R/areal-weights.R
areal_interpolate.Rd

Applies a precomputed areal weight matrix (from areal_weights()) to transfer data from source zones to target polygons.

Usage

areal_interpolate(data, weights)

Arguments

data

Numeric matrix or data.frame [n_source x p]. Data from source zones. Rows must correspond to the columns of weights.

weights

Numeric matrix [n_target x n_source]. Output of areal_weights().

Value

Numeric matrix [n_target x p]. Aggregated values in target polygons.

See also

Other spatial: areal_weights(), compute_travel_times(), download_r5r_data()

Examples

W <- matrix(c(0.7, 0.3, 0.2, 0.8), nrow = 2)  # 2 targets x 2 sources
src_data <- matrix(c(100, 200), nrow = 2)        # 2 sources x 1 variable
areal_interpolate(src_data, W)
#>      [,1]
#> [1,]  110
#> [2,]  190
